intro: Adenosepalum montanum, commonly known as the mountain adenosepalum, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine pubescence. This species is adapted to cold, mountainous environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
